title: Authors and Citation
text: Eisenhauer C (2022). tinker: build faster. R package version 0.0.0.9000.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tinker: build faster},   author = {Catherine Eisenhauer},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000}, }

title: build faster
text: Let’s real, us personal R packages. one mine. data scientist epidemiologist, functions tinker designed make functional programming data visualization easier. sound useful ? Maybe. just shouting void? Probably.

title: .Cut — .cut
text: cut sensible defaults binning continuous variables : includes lowest value observed closed left. default result ordered.

title: .Cut — .cut
text: ordered_result bool TRUE, output ordered factor. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed cut.

title: French (numeric) formatter — french_format
text: Convenience function converts number (int dbl) french format space big mark comma decimal mark. Optional percent formatting available; note case expects proportion input (ie yeild 72%, pass 0.72 72).

title: French (numeric) formatter — french_format
text: x int / dbl Number formatted. decimals int Number decimal values include. Default 0. percent bool Whether format number percent. Warning: french_format() expects proportion (ie 0.72) percent (ie 72). Default FALSE.

title: French (numeric) formatter — french_format
code: val <- 10 / 3 french_format(val) #> [1] "3" french_format(val,               decimals = 2) #> [1] "3,33" french_format(val,               decimals = 1,               percent = TRUE) #> [1] "333,3%"

what: Convert french-style number string to numeric — french_to_numeric
title: Convert french-style number string to numeric — french_to_numeric
text: Takes french style string numberic, example "1 001,5" becomes 1001.5.

title: Convert french-style number string to numeric — french_to_numeric
Convert french-style number string to numeric — french_to_numeric
Convert french-style number string to numeric — french_to_numeric
Start of Week — get_week_start
text: Gets first monday given ISO week-year.

title: Start of Week — get_week_start
text: week int/str ISO week number, zero padding accepted required. year int/str ISO year. Must formatted YYYY.

title: Not in operator — %notin%
text: Convenience operator inverting functionality %%; ie, x %notin% y return bool (vector bools) indicating whether x (members) y.

title: Not in operator — %notin%
text: x value / list Value(s) look y. y list List values.

title: Identify Outbreaks — identify_outbreaks
text: Returns new version df two new columns: "outbreak" "outbreak_id". first bool indicating outbreak present time point second alphanumeric id format "health-zone-name_number" number indicates first, second, etc outbreak identified (within overall data) health zone. Arguments available play identification criteria used. Please refer methods section final report information identification algorithm works.

title: Identify Outbreaks — identify_outbreaks
code: identify_outbreaks(   df,   min_weekly = 20,   min_size = 100,   min_duration = 6,   max_gap = 16,   tail_threshold = 5,   tail_tolerance = 4 )

title: Identify Outbreaks — identify_outbreaks
text: df dataframe Historical data analyzed. note, function strong expectations column names. min_weekly int Number minimum cases expected per week 'main phase' outbreak. Note gaps max_gap length tolerated. min_size int Minimum number cases required 'main phase' epidemic. min_duration int Minimum duration (weeks) required 'main phase' epidemic. max_gap int Maximum lull (weeks) epidemic can dip expected 20 case per week threshold. Gaps longer period indicate two seperate epidemics. tail_threshold int Threshold weekly cases needed inclusion within 'tails' epidemic. tail_tolerance int Minimum number weeks incidence tail_threshold required tails end.

title: IQR — iqr
text: convenience function extract iqr vector formatted string (without square brackets).

title: IQR — iqr
code: iqr(v, digits = 1, percent = FALSE, brackets = FALSE)

title: IQR — iqr
text: v vector vector analyze. digits int number digits decimal show iqr values. percent bool whether display values percents brackets bool TRUE result square brackets (ie: [lower - upper] instead lower - upper). default FALSE.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Run Index — run_index
text: provides index first time logical condition satisfied minimum n times row.

title: Run Index — run_index
text: x vector vector parse. FUN function function indicating condition satisfied. n integer minimum run length (number TRUE values row). default 3. direction string whether parse x forward backwards (resulting first last time run observed respectively). default forward.

what: SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
title: SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
text: Applies SI prefix notation numer, x. intended epidemic estimates works k M .

title: SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
SI prefix notation for large numers — si_format
Source Directory — source_directory
text: Source files specified directory set directories.

title: Source Directory — source_directory
text: path_to_directory string/vector String vector strings specifying directory sourced. Path name include trailing '/' recursive bool Whether source files recursively (directory subdirectories). default FALSE.

what: Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
title: Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
text: Creates html string providing french format color x well adding / arrow. default, x red positive, grey 0, blue negative, can inverted. Wrapping text parentheses optional.

title: Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
code: up_down_format(   x,   flip_colors = FALSE,   percent = TRUE,   decimals = 0,   parentheses = TRUE )

title: Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
text: x dbl Number formatted. flip_colors bool TRUE, default color scheme reversed negative values red positive values blue. Default FALSE. percent bool TRUE, x interpreted proportion (ie 0.56) displayed percent (ie. 56%). Default TRUE. decimals int Number decimals include x. Default 0. parentheses bool TRUE, text wrapped parentheses. Default TRUE.

title: Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
Up / down formatting for a number — up_down_format
code: x <- 5 y <- -10.76 up_down_format(x) #> [1] "(▲500%)" up_down_format(x, flip_colors = TRUE, parentheses = FALSE) #> [1] "▲500%" up_down_format(y, percent = FALSE, decimals = 1) #> [1] "(▼10,8)"

title: Validate Names — validate_names
text: Utility function assist name validation / fixing. function update names user provided list zone (smaller) region (larger) levels provided. also print list remaining unmatched / invalid names. WARNING : function opinionated assumes df_new df_ref columns called "zone" "reg"; columns present function fail.

title: Validate Names — validate_names
code: validate_names(df_new, df_ref, fix_zone = NULL, fix_reg = NULL)

title: Validate Names — validate_names
text: df_new dataframe Dataframe names validated / fixed. df_ref dataframe Reference dataframe containing accepted names want match . fix_zone list Named list correct zone names (zone smaller geographic level).  provided, list used update df_new must format list  names (keys) match df_new list values updated (correct) names. default NULL. fix_reg list Named list correct region names (region larger geographic level). Equivalent fix_zone region level. Default NULL.
